definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: My credit card bill is due on the third of every month.
sentences.chinese: 十月三号是德国的国定假日。

sentences.english: Tuesday has been declared a national holiday.
sentences.chinese: 星期二已被宣布为国定假日。

sentences.english: New Year's Day is a public holiday throughout Britain.
sentences.chinese: 元旦节在英国的全部地区都算是国定假日。

sentences.english: Monday is the national holiday that celebrates the life of the civil rights leader.
sentences.chinese: 星期一是国定假日，庆祝生命的民权领袖。

sentences.english: The underground trains in Shanghai are always overcrowded, especially on National holidays.
sentences.chinese: 上海的地铁总是很拥挤的，尤其是在国定假日。

sentences.english: In our country, but also on the national holidays.
sentences.chinese: 在我国，还列入了国定假日。

sentences.english: See below for the full list of national holidays in Sweden.
sentences.chinese: 见下文的完整名单在瑞典的国定假日。

sentences.english: What happens if payday falls on a bank holiday.
sentences.chinese: 发薪日如果碰上国定假日该怎么办？

definition: to shift holidays, taking a weekday off
to compensate for working on a holiday by resting on a workday/to compensate for resting on a workday by working on a holiday
to take deferred time off (to make up for working during the weekend or holidays)/compensatory leave
to have a holiday or vacation
